content: Anybody else have these kinds of problems? Just tonight, I walked into the kitchen to deposit a dirty bowl into the sink. I intended to leave there and go to the bathroom. On the way out, I spotted a piece of trash lying on the countertop which needed to go to the trash, so I detoured that way (WITHOUT PICKING UP THE TRASH!) As I approached the trash bin, I started unzipping my fly!! What was I about to do? Whiz in the trash? YES...that's EXACTLY what I was about to do because I got two, totally different goals intermingled! The older I get, the more suicide becomes an option....just to keep from embarrassing myself.

content: Hey, I was going to take Mystical over to another town to watch our grandson perform in a Junior High Orchestra. Now there was heavy equipment grinding up the road in front of our house earlier, and I had gone out to get the front loader driver to dump some of the gravel in places that formed bad puddles when it rained, and I used a shovel to push some of it around, wearing gloves, of course - - Now, it comes time to get ready and go to the concert. I bath, get dressed, put on my watch coat etc. Then reach for my car keys. Gone! My wallet. Gone! Time is wasting - getting close to start time... No keys and wallet!! Mystical is getting impatient and finally says she will drive. Then I see my work gloves sitting on the kitchen counter, where they shouldn't be - so as we leave, I take them out to put them in the work bench drawer where I normally keep them.... There set my keys and wallet - - Never have I done that before . . . I think - - Wandering and Wondering

Mystical is getting impatient and finally says she will drive. content: quote: Originally posted by greywolfghost: Hey, I was going to take Mystical over to another town to watch our grandson perform in a Junior High Orchestra. Now there was heavy equipment grinding up the road in front of our house earlier, and I had gone out to get the front loader driver to dump some of the gravel in places that formed bad puddles when it rained, and I used a shovel to push some of it around, wearing gloves, of course - - Now, it comes time to get ready and go to the concert. I bath, get dressed, put on my watch coat etc. Then reach for my car keys. Gone! My wallet. Gone! Time is wasting - getting close to start time... No keys and wallet!! Mystical is getting impatient and finally says she will drive. Then I see my work gloves sitting on the kitchen counter, where they shouldn't be - so as we leave, I take them out to put them in the work bench drawer where I normally keep them.... There set my keys and wallet - - Never have I done that before . . . I think - - Aw, don't feel too badly. I was making gravy the other day and when I was finished, I put the flour in the refrigerator and the milk up in the cabinet. Of course, later it was, "Where the hell is the milk?"

content: quote: Originally posted by stillkit: Anybody else have these kinds of problems? Just tonight, I walked into the kitchen to deposit a dirty bowl into the sink. I intended to leave there and go to the bathroom. On the way out, I spotted a piece of trash lying on the countertop which needed to go to the trash, so I detoured that way (WITHOUT PICKING UP THE TRASH!) As I approached the trash bin, I started unzipping my fly!! What was I about to do? Whiz in the trash? YES...that's EXACTLY what I was about to do because I got two, totally different goals intermingled! The older I get, the more suicide becomes an option....just to keep from embarrassing myself. Ya know what's scary? Been there, done that and I'm only 45. Yes, I did catch myself in time. Don
